title: Vito Rizzuto
summary: Vito Rizzuto (Italian: [ˈviːto ritˈtsuːto]; February 21, 1946 – December 23, 2013), also known as "Montreal's Teflon Don",[1] was an Italian-Canadian crime boss alleged to be the leader of the Sicilian Mafia in Canada. He headed the notorious Rizzuto crime family based in Montreal, Quebec.
